Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • Card

  • public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    Objects represent cards in a typical deck of playing cards.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dr. Jody Paul

    • Method Detail

      • generateCardID

        public static int generateCardID(Rank cardRank,
                                 Suit cardSuit)
        Utility to generate an integer card ID. 
        cardID = (cardSuit.ordinal() * Rank.values().length)) + cardRank.ordinal()
        Parameters:
        cardRank - the rank of the card
        cardSuit - the suit of the card
        Returns:
        the cardID associated with the given rank and suit

      • retrieveRank

        public static Rank retrieveRank(int cardid)
        Utility to retrieve rank from an integer card ID.
        Parameters:
        cardid - the card ID to process
        Returns:
        the rank associated with the given card ID

      • retrieveSuit

        public static Suit retrieveSuit(int cardid)
        Utility to retrieve suit from an integer card ID.
        Parameters:
        cardid - the card ID to process
        Returns:
        the suit associated with the given card ID

      • toString

        public final java.lang.String toString()
        Renders this card as commonly used phrase: rank of suit. Examples: "Five of Diamonds", "King of Hearts"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        common name of this card

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overridden equals method; both rank and suit must be the same.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to compare with this card
        Returns:
        true if and only if rank and suit match
